body_html:
This looks like you're passing a DoubleTensor and FloatTensor to your criterion. To debug, I'd try

loss = criterion(model_prediction.float(), target_variable.float())

If this works you know that either your model forward() produces a DoubleTensor and the target is Float, or the other way around.
body_text:
This looks like you're passing a DoubleTensor and FloatTensor to your criterion. To debug, I'd try
loss = criterion(model_prediction.float(), target_variable.float())
If this works you know that either your model forward() produces a DoubleTensor and the target is Float, or the other way around.
body:
This looks like you're passing a DoubleTensor and FloatTensor to your criterion. To debug, I'd try

```Python
loss = criterion(model_prediction.float(), target_variable.float())
```
If this works you know that either your model forward() produces a DoubleTensor and the target is Float, or the other way around.
